section.name: drools
section.p: drools is an augmented implementation of Forgy's Rete algorithm, tailored for the object-oriented language of Java. Adapting Rete to an object-oriented interface allows for more natural expression of business rules with regards to business objects.

subsection.name: Rete-OO
subsection.p: The drools engine uses a modified form of the Rete algorithm called the Rete-OO algorithm. Internally, it operates using the same concepts and methods as Forgy's original, but adds some node types required for seemless integration with an object-oriented language.

subsection.name: Semantics Provider Interface & Framework
subsection.p: At the core drools is purely an Rete-OO algorithmic engine. The engine works in terms of very abstracted concepts, such as FilterConditions, Declarations and FactExtractors. Though the usage of concrete semantics modules the algorithmic engine can be given any interface desired.
